extendedIngredients.name: carrots
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup spiralized carrots (I used rainbow carrots)

extendedIngredients.name: extra-virgin olive oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: Your favorite dressing, or lemon juice and extra virgin olive oil

extendedIngredients.name: red bell pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup red bell pepper, diced

extendedIngredients.name: sea-salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: sea salt and fresh ground pepper, to taste

recipes.title: Rainbow Quinoa Vegetable Salad

winePairing.pairingText: Salad works really well with Chardonnay, Gruener Veltliner, and Sauvignon Blanc. Sauvignon Blanc and Gruner Veltliner both have herby notes that complement salads with enough acid to match tart vinaigrettes, while a Chardonnay can be a good pick for creamy salad dressings. One wine you could try is District 7 Estate Chardonnay. It has 5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 18 dollars.

productMatches.title: District 7 Estate Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Our 2012 vintage has aromas of tropical fruit and butterscotch that lead into a lively blend of pear, pineapple and citrus flavors

recipes.instructions: Place quinoa, tomatoes, carrots, red bell pepper, beans and scallion in a bowl; toss with your favorite salad dressing (or just squeeze some fresh lemon juice on top and drizzle a little extra virgin olive oil on top).

steps.step: Place quinoa, tomatoes, carrots, red bell pepper, beans and scallion in a bowl; toss with your favorite salad dressing (or just squeeze some fresh lemon juice on top and drizzle a little extra virgin olive oil on top).
